bibl.note: This document is a brief letter dated November 22, 1827 from Sam Brown in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to governor Sam Houston in Nashville, Tennessee. In the letter, Brown discusses a proposal for establishing a public library in Tennessee, and every state in the union.

div.p: When you have examined the proposal, made by my friend Mr Mister Letrell, for establishing a Public library, in Tennessee & in every other state in the union, I can have no hesitation in believing that you will give it your most cordial support__ The liberal spirit manifested by your legislature in granting funds to the Nashville University, inspires confidence that, with your recommendation & that our your funds, this important national object will be accomplished & that lasting benefits will result.

His Excellency gov governor Houston Nashville Tennessee
Mr Litell
